fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39357].
  {panel}

Hi,
I'm in AtlasDesk, working on the ADM project.

Sometimes, we solve an issue so fast (within a few minutes), the statuses change in a normal order: from Unassign -> In Progress -> Resolved, ... 

But the user got the notification emails in a wrong order, because we were too fast to solved it (around 2 mins - as we experienced).

Please let me know if you want more details or need a real case to look at.
Regards,
Phong Thai
fields.summary: Notification emails NOT coming in the right order

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39355].
  {panel}

From the documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deletingauser], it is not possible to delete a user if:
* reported or been assigned to any issues
* commented on any issues

Most of the time, users have done one of the above actions, and deleting them is not possible. Therefore it is always recommended for the users to be deactivated.
fields.summary: Recommend Deactivate User instead of Deleting User
Search for comments from a particular user
Add the ability in the UI for a specific node to request a new index from the cluster

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39349].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA only links commits based on searching for the JIRA Key (<PROJ-NUM>) in the commit message.

It would be very useful if users could add additional criteria to link Issues and Commits.  In particular this is necessary for migrating clients (e.g. from Redmine) to allow historical linkages to be maintained without rewriting your source control history.

Example: Importing from Redmine
* Redmine looks for #<issue_id> to associate commits with issues
* The JIRA/Redmine importer brings the Redmine issue_id into the "External issue id" field by default

If it was possible to add a configuration such that JIRA searched for "#<External issue id>" along with the JIRA key then all historical commit-issue linkages would be maintained.
fields.summary: Provide greater flexibility to auto-link JIRA Issues to source control commits

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39348].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Add a restricted comment to an issue.
# without refreshing the page proceed to add another comment

*Expected result*
 The comment restriction is reset back to default or "viewable by all users". So you don't accidentally restrict a comment without meaning too, or restrict to the wrong security level.

*Actual result*
Instead, the previously applied security level is applied to the new comment automatically. If you refresh the page however, it is set back to the default
fields.summary: Previously applied comment security level should not persist for subsequent comments
Auditing localication improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39346].
  {panel}

For example:
1. Support Staff Submits Bug
2. Developers resolve bug which sets due date 5 days from transition
3. Support/QA test, confirm fix, close bug
fields.summary: Ability to set due date automatically by a workflow post function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39342].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

If you have an Issue Type with a long value for its name, the name will get truncated when trying to select this issue type from a list.

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the user to define the length of the fields in JIRA.
fields.summary: Increase the length of the Issue Type field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39340].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

It is possible for a user to be added into JIRA using the same email address as another user who is already inside JIRA

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a user with a test email address (for example, test@test.com)
# Create another user, using the same email address of test@test.com
# The creation of the second user will proceed without any problems

h3. Additional info

* If the admin uses 'Invite User' instead, it will check with the existing users and will detect if a user with that email address is already present within JIRA
* Allowing multiple users with the same email can cause problems with the mail handlers (for example, if two users have the same email, which user will be chosen as the reporter?)
fields.summary: Users should not be able to be added with the same email
JIRA REST API for creating issue returns 201 on success

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39335].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is some startup info in the logs that can confuse customers, for example:

{quote}
Maximum Allowable Memory : 682MB
Total Memory : 364MB
Free Memory : 170MB
Used Memory : 194MB
{quote}

This is output even when XmX (JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY) is set to 768m.

h3. Suggested Solution
Can we please remove this as it's not particularly helpful for customers - thanks. :)
fields.summary: Remove unnecessary memory info from the startup logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39327].
  {panel}

The Development panel currently shows the commits and branches related to the issue being displayed, through integration with Stash (and other VCSs). However, in an agile Git workflow, we create a branch for every story/bug/... and we solve subtasks in one or a few commits within that branch. As such, the parent issue usually displays 1 branch and a number of merge commits, and the subtasks display no branches (and of course the commits related to them).

I would suggest that the parent issue should display the branches related to it, and the commits related to itself + the commits related to its subtasks. The subtasks could display the branches related to themselves + the branches related to their parent, and only the commits related to themselves.

This way, while viewing a subtask you could get straight to the branch related to it even if that branch is linked to the parent issue, and while viewing the parent issue you would get a proper overview of the commits that have been done to resolve it even if those commits are linked to subtasks.

Also, while viewing a subtask you should not see commits related to the parent issue or sibling subtasks (unless they're also related to the subtask at hand, of course), since at that point you would expect a more specific/detailed view, and while viewing a parent issue you should not see branches of subtasks because you should view the subtasks themselves to get to their branches anyway.
fields.summary: show commits related to subtasks of the issue being displayed
All the UI changes made in form submission handler (only with standard page reload) are not rendered on Safari 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39325].
  {panel}

As administrator of a JIRA instance
I would like to *control who is allowed to transition issue statuses for Simplified workflow-based projects*
so that *people other than team members cannot transition issues*, just as they cannot edit (or create) them.

_Additional explanation_:
Issue creation or editing is controlled by a specific permission while, to-date, issue transition can only be controlled using Transition Conditions at workflow level.
While this is feasible (yet time consuming) for custom workflows, it becomes difficult for Simplified Workflows, where conditions are added implicitly as we add statuses.

I would find fair that platform admins could control issue transitions, especially since even project admins cannot modify their own Simplified Workflow on this aspect
fields.summary: Permission for transitioning issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39324].
  {panel}

Good day,
 
 
 
Please assist as we would like for JIRA to allow us to configure fields in such a way that when creating an issue, two of the following scenarios happen on a dropdown:
 
a) when selecting 'No', fields become greyed out, meaning there are no further options.
 
b) when selecting 'Yes', mandatory fields become visible for the user to populate.
 
 
 
Your assistance is highly appreciated
 
Rethabile M
fields.summary: JIRA fields behaviour
File-Input fields in LookAndFeel dialog should have class "ignore-inline-attach"
Try to remove SearchContext usages on the SearchRenderer hierarchy
Try to remove SearchContext usages on the SearchInputTransformer hierarchy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39315].
  {panel}

Hi there,

We run Jira (5.2.11) on SSL . Our HTTP gets re-directed to HTTPS.
What should we add as the Jira base URL? Will it be the HTTP one or the HTTPS one?

Thanks
Priya
fields.summary: Configuring Base URL for Jira
Ability to send alert popup in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39312].
  {panel}

When looking at the JIRA Version Summary, it would be great if we could link to a GIT tag/commit that the version was built from.  Since JIRA can link a project to Bitbucket, this shouldn't be hard to simply add a link for it.

To be even more powerful, it would be cool if JIRA could show the Git log for all commits since the last JIRA Version, assuming both versions have a link to the tag/commit (in other words, automatically set the git log length, based on the previous Version tag).

And one step further, be able to have tag/commit links to multiple repos, since a single project version may draw from libraries in separate git repositories.  

And if all this could be set via an HTTP API, then we could script it to create all these links from a Maven build (or from Bamboo, etc) to automatically setup all this links for us, and then have a complete Git Log of all the changes in our non-third-party code from multiple libraries.
fields.summary: Link JIRA Version to Bitbucket Tag/Commit
Renaming a Project, filters will stop working.
Add the ability to reply to comments on Jira
Different License Tiers
Show minimum required privileges on login screen
Migrate users screen should be more clear.
Localization of "Rank increased" is not correct in german language
Incorrect background colour on body in CSS, breaking the footer
JIRA Cloud bulk operation timeout due to webhook notifications
Add keyboard shortcut to change priority field in an issue
How can we get a report time stamp for an issue is in each status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39291].
  {panel}

While we are using *Cascading Select List* both parents and child select list are *single choice select list*.
I wish to do *multiple choices select* on the *child select list*.
For Example I have this cascading Select List:
| Parent List Options | Child List Options |
| A                             | one                       |
|                                | two                        |
| B                             | three                     |
|                                | four                       |

I would want to select A then select both one and two at the child list.
fields.summary: Enable Multiple Choices Select List on Cascading Child Select List.
Different Behavior Between Quick and Basic/Advanced Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39288].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
If a custom field name is too long without a space in between, it will be displayed in a single line overlapping whatever is in its way:
!custom field.jpg|thumbnail!

h4. Suggestions
* It would be better to have a limit on the number of characters that can be entered on a custom field name
_OR_
* The custom field name should be separated into a new line where it meets a condition e.g. after every 20 characters

h4. Workaround
Use one or more spaces in between that will separate the custom field name into multiple lines
fields.summary: Limit the number of characters in a custom field name
JIRA to Integrate with LDAP via Kerberos Protocol

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39282].
  {panel}

When a user tries to access an existing JQL filter's URL without logging in to JIRA, the issue navigator will output some errors based on the search clauses in the JQL, such as:
# "Field 'resolution' does not exist or this field cannot be viewed by anonymous users."
# "Not able to sort using field 'priority'."

For the *Projects* field instead, it shows:
*"A value with ID '3222' does not exist for the field 'project'."* 

This is misleading because it says "the value does not exist", but rather it's just not visible to non-logged-in users. 
The message should be changed to something like:
*"A value with ID '3222' does not exist for the field 'project', or you do not have permission to view that project."*
fields.summary: Standardize JQL permissions error messages
Don't send me E-Mails if I mention myself in a comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39278].
  {panel}

This is an expensive calculation.

We used to do this heavily for searching because we cared about only showing you as column options _only_ the ones that could be used for search "context".

Context = Projects and Issue Types applicable to the issues that will be returned by the current search.

We no longer do this smartness because it's not performant at scale. Therefore, we need to limit the number of places that do this around the codebase to the minimum.
fields.summary: Investigate context calculation and subsequent filtering of navigable fields in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39277].
  {panel}

JIRA's startup checks produce user facing error messages on failure. However these messages are not being passed through the i18n helper. If JIRA fails to start we won't have access to the user's preferred language, but we may be able to take the system default.

The list of checks that require i18n work are:

    Build178SchemaCheck
    BuildVersionCheck
    FailedStartupCheck
    JiraHomeStartupCheck
    MinimumUpgradableVersionCheck
    PostgresSchemaConfigCheck
    PublicSchemaConfigCheck
    SystemPluginsEnabledStartupCheck
fields.summary: Startup checks are not internationalised
Remove slow execution path on RunSearchRequest

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39275].
  {panel}

On {{DefaultSearchRequestURLHandler#handleRequest}}, there is an execution path that ends up calling {{getSearchRequestFactory().createFromParameters(null, loggedInUser, new ActionParamsImpl(parameters));}}.

That {{createFromParameters}} method is deprecated on {{SearchRequestFactory}} because it's very slow since it ends up calculating the context for the given query.

As we already know, calculating such context is an expensive operation that has a poor performance on large JIRA instances.

Luckily, that execution path can be removed from DefaultSearchRequestURLHandler, since it is only reached when the jql string parameter is null. After investigation, we have come to the conclusion that the only way of getting a null jql parameter is if the user plays with that url and removes it. 

We should remove this execution path by handling the null case as if it was an empty jql string.
fields.summary: Remove slow execution path on DefaultSearchRequestURLHandler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39274].
  {panel}

There are some standard email addresses that are intended to be ignored. RFC 2606 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2606) lists .example, .invalid etc.
At the moment JIRA tries to send email to these addresses 10 times before giving up. This is an extra, unnecessary load of the outgoing mail thread.

A valid use case for such email addresses is service or headless accounts. A JIRA user is created so that a remote system can log in and create issues. As the reporter of the issue that user account is sent email. But no-one ever wants to read email for a service account!

An alternative would be to allow JIRA users to not specify an email account, or flag the account as a service account.
fields.summary: Invalid email addresses cause performance problems in large JIRA instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39273].
  {panel}

The JIRA Misc Workflows Extension condition that blocks an user from performing an transition based on the previous transitions he performed, also known as the *Separation of Duties Condition* is not working on the latest version of JIRA Cloud.

A bug report has been [raised with the developer|https://innovalog.atlassian.net/browse/JMWE-251].

*Steps to replicate:*
# Add the *Separation of Duties Condition* on a specific status
# Perform the status transition that should block the second transition on which you set the *Separation of Duties Condition* 
# User is able to perform the transition even if they shouldn't be allowed to.

If you are currently using this functionality, please be aware of the impact to your workflow conditions.

*Workaround:*
You may disable to add-on in JIRA Cloud to prevent the usage of the workflow condition.
Please follow the bug with the developer for further workarounds and updates as they become available.
fields.summary: The "Separation of Duties Condition" is not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39271].
  {panel}

When a user logs in through the standard JIRA log-in page (clicking on the *Log In* button on the top-right-hand corner), its a HTTP session.
But when a user logs in via the log-in gadget, it becomes a REST session. 
Both of these information can be seen via {{Administration >> System >> User Sessions}}. 
We should document the differences between them to explain how sessions in JIRA work.
fields.summary: Document the differences between REST and HTTP sessions shown in the User Sessions page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39266].
  {panel}

Based on the documentation of [User access logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/User+access+logging] user could get information of what page are being accessed by a certain user in a certain time. For now, the access logs is only showing the information that is targeted into JIRA. Therefore, it would be useful if JIRA could capture or include the logs when JIRA is requesting/receiving information from outside. For example:
# JIRA gadgets requesting info from outside HTTP sources such as Jenkins or confluence servers.
# JIRA requests through Application Links to other Atlassian tools such as confluence.

This could be useful when analyzing server load, it is interesting to know what is the volume of data exchanged between clients - server including sessions originating from the server itself.
fields.summary: Improved JIRA Access logs
When deleting an item from JIRA administration, there should be a pop-up instead of redirection

Return to the previous page

Atlassian JIRA Project Management Software (v6.3.3#6331-sha1:d919e5c)
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Using JIRA 6.3.1, connect it to a Confluence instance
# Try to link a JIRA ticket to a Confluence page, using the 'Search for a page' functionality
# It will fail/get stuck (no errors in the GUI), but if the development tools are used, this can be seen :

!applink.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional info :

* If the user links the page directly via the URL of the Confluence page, it will work with no problem
* Other applink functionalities (such as JIRA Issue Macro) seems to be working fine
* This appears to only happen in JIRA 6.3.1. During the test, it was connected with Confluence 5.5.3 

h3. Workaround

For now, I would recommend that the links from JIRA issue to Confluence page be done directly via the URL of the page
fields.summary: Unable to link JIRA issue to Confluence page (500 Internal Server Error)
Keyboard Shortcut for Jira Editor Preview

As a PO I would like to be able to arrange the attached images of an issue, so a sequence of actions can be described better by looking at a series of comps.

A/C:
- Hovering an attached image will show 'move' pointer 
- User can drag the image to a different location among other images
- After mouse button is release, the new arrangement will be saved

Trying to attach a screenshot to an issue.

1. Copy image to cliboard.
2. Click 'Attach Screenshot' on issue.
3. Paste image in to dialog, get error message:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39252].
  {panel}

We would like a way to display a message to an authenticated user upon login.  The message doesn't need to remain showing (as is done with the "Announcement Banner"), it can be dismissed.  
Once dismissed the message would not appear on subsequent logins.
There would also need to be a way to reset the dismissed message so that the next time the user logged in, the message would re-appear and they would need to acknowledge and dismiss it again.

The idea is along the lines of quarterly security policy reminder for Jira usage.

This needs to be available in OnDemand versions
fields.summary: Display Message to Authenticated Users which can be Dismissed

Also please note im using JIRA::Client perl module for scripting 

URGENT help needed!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39245].
  {panel}

h4. Outdated Intel in the Scaling JIRA FAQ
* Ref URL: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Scaling+JIRA+FAQ

Does JIRA support clustering or Failover/HA?
No, JIRA does not support clustering. We do however have a guide on Failover for JIRA.

From this google search: *(automated to make it easier to appreciate)*
* h4. http://lmgtfy.com/?q=atlassian+jira+how+to+scale+failover

The first two hits have a resounding 'NO' after the question 'does jira support clustering' - screenshot of latest doc included
fields.summary: JIRA Scaling FAQ: Does JIRA support clustering or Failover/HA?No, JIRA does not

  {panel}

In JIRA 6.2 when using "details navigator view" it would be useful to see the values that are being ordered in the list view.
This has been raised by a few users here now and based on the response to the question raised in the answers forum the old solution is to go back to the list view.
This seems to go against the reasoning for the details view (no page reloads)

I have attached a quick mock up of what I mean, in the mock up it is ordered by fix version
fields.summary: Ability to see the field value you are ordering on in the issue navigator detail view

Just take for example my organization, papelclubdevp

https://papelclubdevp.atlassian.net

acceding to the upper link, it gets the login screen, which even gives the non-register users the knowledge of the existence of this organization, it is acceptable, 

but accessing to "more internal" addresses, it allows to jump into the dashboard, of course no internals are shown, but I got surprise that the dashboard is shown

https://papelclubdevp.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa

It would be more thinkable that the user get forwarded to the login/registration window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39224].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a checkbox with few options and associate to screens
# Create a new issues.
# Go to Edit dialog, tick all the options of the checkbox and save the changes.
# Use inline edit and untick any option of the field. Save the changes.
# Use inline edit for the second attempt and the problem will show up.

h4. Expected Behaviour:
All options of checkbox are rendered correctly in the view issue page.

h4. Actual Behaviour:
The first option will be overlapped by the second option:
!example.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround
* Refresh the page before perform inline edit again.
* Use the Edit option.
fields.summary: Checkbox options overlapped on inline edit

fields.description:
Begin with a workflow in JIRA that is already associated with a project.

Copy that workflow and give it a new name. Create a new workflow scheme and associate the new workflow with that scheme. Create a new project and assign the new workflow scheme to it.

Make three changes to the new workflow:

1) Modify status, for instance change Open to ToDo
2) Modify transition, for instance change Start Progress to Begin Work
3) Associate the new workflow with a different set of issue types than the original workflow

Despite these changes being made to a copy that is associated with a different scheme and a different project, the original workflow will pick up at least some of the changes to statuses, but not to transitions or issue types.

The reverse is true as well. I had this happen accidentally this morning when I created a copy of an existing workflow and ran through the above. When it was brought to my attention, I went to fix the original workflow, only to discover that in the Administration -> Workflows view, the original workflow still looked fine and matched what was expected. Through that view, it had not been edited. The timestamp of the last edit had also not been updated. When viewing the original workflow through the project to which it was attached, however, the changes were visible. This despite no changes having been published to any workflow, including the copy.

You cannot directly edit a workflow through a Project -> Administration view, but I got to it through the workflow scheme and reverted the changes on the original workflow. I  then checked my copy and saw that the copied workflow had the statuses changed, but the additional status I'd created, as well as the transitions I'd modified, were still there.

It looks like a copied workflow continues to reference the same database rows/columns for statuses despite referencing new/different rows/columns for transitions. I would expect a copy to be completely autonomous of the original.
fields.summary: Changes to a copied workflow impact the original workflow
Issue Icon next to the Summary for View Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39218].
  {panel}

While doing a basic search from the Issue Navigator, trying to select one of several projects with long project names starting with the same set of words or characters that extend beyond the 250px width of the project drop down menu, can be quite confusing to users. As the project names get truncated by the limited width and are hard to differentiate.
!ProjectMenu.PNG|width=30%!

It would be great to possibly extend the width of the project drop down menu to atleast 400 - 500px to allow for more visiblity.

*Workarounds*:
* Note that you should be able to see the project name in full, by hovering your mouse over each project name from the drop-down list.
* The project name can be shortened so that it correctly appears.
* It is possible to customise the JIRA UI by CSS to extend the width of the drop down menu. If you need assistance with that you could try posting on https://answers.atlassian.com, as this kind of customisations are beyond Atlassian Support Scope
* In the Project Field, the user could specify the project's unique project key to avoid confusion with the long project names.
fields.summary: Project drop down menu in Issue Navigator should make full Project Name visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39215].
  {panel}

h4. Situation
Issue statuses in Basic Search in the Issue Navigator can only be found by the translation of the language pack used by the current user. The same status in the Advanced search (or JQL), can only be found by the original value.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Set the Default language of JIRA to English
# Set the user language of JIRA to Dutch
# Create a status "Deleted"
# Through the Translate statuses option, add a translation to Dutch "Verwijderd"
# Generate issues in status "Verwijderd"

h4. Expected result
When searching for issues through the Advanced Search in the issue navigator (or other searches using JQL) in status "Verwijderd", the previously generated issues will be found

h4. Actual result
No issues can be found in status "Verwijderd". However issues can be found in status "Deleted
fields.summary: JQL can not use translated values for status
The link prompting the user to 'Check out the JIRA 101 guide' takes you to a 404 page on CAC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39212].
  {panel}

I did some work for support back in December, but it seems I never merged it :(

The changes I made improved the error prevention and error logging for issue collectors, and actually fixed some really incorrect code.

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-issue-collector-plugin/pull-request/2

These changes should be merged in to the issue collector's 1.3 branch as well as its HEAD.
fields.summary: Merge error logging and fixes for issue collector

Add empty custom field values to Issue Navigator XML export
As an admin, I would like the ability to opt-out/disable any analytics from being transmitted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39201].
  {panel}

Hi,

We noticed 3 typos in the french version of JIRA:

1-Comment notification: 
   "Fabien Pelletier a ajouté un commentaire" instead of "Fabien Pelletier à ajouter un commentaire"
  
2-Service desk config SLA : button label
    "Sauver et Rafraichir" instead of "Sauver et Raffraichir"
    =>remove one "f"

3-Service desk config SLA : message label:
   "La configuration a changé et doit être recalculée..." instead of "La configuration a changée et doit être recalculé..."
    =>remove the last "e" to changé and add one to recalculé

Thanks
François
fields.summary: French Typo in JIRA and Service desk On demand
Ability to have the "create issue" step of a workflow behave differently depending on some conditions such as group or role membership
Automatic link the issues raised under differ accounts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39195].
  {panel}

A change log / version gadget showing an overview over the already released versions of projects would be quite handy. Visually I'm imagining basically something like the roadmap gadget but for already released versions.

You can already somehow achieve something like this with the two-dimensional filter statistics (see: attached screenshot), but that has two main drawbacks:
a) clicking on the versionnumber I'd like to be presented the release notes report of the project instead of the issue list for that version as it does atm (or some other means to access the release notes directly from within that gadget view)
b) visually it's not quite appealing (the style of the roadmap gadget would be much more preferable for a change log / version gadget).

Was also already suggested/discussed here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/37129/released-versions-change-log-gadget
fields.summary: Change log gadget
Document known limitations on JIRA Supported Platforms page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39186].
  {panel}

I want to place "Activity stream" gadget on shared dashboard.
And every user must see his own activity on this gadget.
But there is no way to specify special username for CurrentUser in configuration settings of "Activity stream" gadget.

This issue has been opened before but was closed because activity stream used to be a plugin.  As far as I can tell, this is no longer the case.
fields.summary: a way to select CurrentUser as username for shared dashboards
Hide/Show fields without reloading the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39182].
  {panel}

We are using the "auto merge" features offered in Stash, specifically in the fashion of having an X percentage of reviewers approve and then auto merge.

The issue with that is, let's say i leave a comment that is not necessarily code related but more architecturally, which leaves me not to decline the merge request, but i also don't really want the request to be auto merged before the team or the developer can explain to me the what when and where.
 
In order to prevent the auto merge it would be awesome if i can "attach" the pull request to a task and if that task is in a certain (designated) column on the Agile board, the merge request will NOT be auto merged, no matter how many reviewers have approved the request.

The reason this would work better in the process, is because when i decline the request, others can't (easily) complete their review since the pull request is no longer clearly visible  for other users.
fields.summary: Link a Stash repo with a status on the Agile board
Hide assignee in personal Tasks list
Multiple Repositories Path to one JIRA Project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-39175].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate:*

# Create a project with a workflow that does not set the resolution at any point
# Change the edit screen so that it has the 'resolution' field on it
# Create an issue
# Edit the issue to set a resolution

*Result:*

Issue does not have a resolved date

*Expected result:*

The issue has a resolved date and resolutiondate in the database has been updated.

*Workaround*

The resolution field should be altered either through a post-function, or by a screen specifically used to resolve issues. You should *not* have the resolved field on the edit issue screen.
fields.summary: Changing a resolution by editing an issue does not set a resolved date
Add jira-config.properties file to the Modified Files
Export vs Views usage in configuration parameters
